channel.title: Comments on: My First Android Application (Ubuntu Linux)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.description: Still good news and prospect for future tools. Android really needs to become accessible to the bedroom coder if it wants to make in-roads into the world of the 'Nerd' (and thus more sales).
item.content:encoded: Still good news and prospect for future tools. Android really needs to become accessible to the bedroom coder if it wants to make in-roads into the world of the ‘Nerd’ (and thus more sales).

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: You can't deploy monodroid apps to an actual device yet, and there is no support for the linux version of monodevelop (mac only). It's quite good though if you like the C# way of doing things.
item.content:encoded: You can’t deploy monodroid apps to an actual device yet, and there is no support for the linux version of monodevelop (mac only). It’s quite good though if you like the C# way of doing things.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Cool I hope to see an app in the Android market place soon

My wife loves her Droid X phone

another approach for the people that do know c# and .net is Mono for Android. Miguel de Icaza’s announcement from yesterday can be found here: Mono for Android
